wifi_version.description:
Wi-Fi operation mode:
`1` = Wi-Fi 1 (802.11b) (Only 2.4 GHz),
`2` = Wi-Fi 2 (IEEE 802.11a) (Only 5 GHz),
`3` = Wi-Fi 3 (IEEE 802.11g) (only 2.4 GHz),
`4` = Wi-Fi 4 (IEEE 802.11n) (2.4/5 GHz),
`5` = Wi-Fi 5 (IEEE 802.11ac) (only 5 GHz),
`6` = Wi-Fi 6/6E (IEEE 802.11ax) (2.4/5 GHz for Wi-Fi 6, 2.4/5/6 GHz for Wi-Fi 6E),
`7` = Wi-Fi 7 (IEEE 802.11be) (2.4/5/6 GHz)

band.description: Wi-Fi Operating frequency: `2.4` OR `5`. The default should be fine. 6 GHz is NOT supported!

country_code.description: Wi-Fi Country code (ISO/IEC 3166-1). Used to set regulatory domain. Set as needed to indicate country in which device is operating. This can limit available channels and transmit power.

wpa_passphrase.description: Wi-Fi password used as the WPA pre-shared key (WPA-PSK)

logfile.description: Log file path, by default it is saved to `/var/log` in `tmpfs`/memory. If you want, you can change it e.g. to `/data/aa-proxy-rs.log` and it will be saved to SD card (appended, not replaced).

stats_interval.description: Interval of showing data transfer statistics in the log (0 = disabled) [seconds]

timeout_secs.description: Data transfer timeout [seconds], after this idle time the session will be reconnected

legacy.description: Enable legacy USB mode (some HeadUnits/cars needs this enabled for compatibility)

wired.description:
Enable wired USB connection to phone (VID:PID should be specified, zero is wildcard and can be used for single or both fields)
you can obtain it e.g. using `lsusb` after connecting phone,
and then use e.g. "18d1:0" which will handle specified phone vendor ID (Google Pixel in this example)

dhu.description: Use a Google Android Auto Desktop Head Unit emulator instead of real HU device (will listen on TCP 5277 port)

udc.description: UDC Controller name (used in special configurations)

startup_delay.description:
Enables delaying the launch of `aa-proxy-rs` by a specified number of seconds (range: 0‚Äì254).
Default value: 0.
Intended for specific scenarios (e.g., non-standard head units)

hexdump_level.description: Hex dump level [possible values: Disabled, DecryptedInput, RawInput, DecryptedOutput, RawOutput, All]

disable_console_debug.description: Disable debug level on console, save it only to logfile (helpful for `hexdump-level` option)

btalias.description:
BLE device name (how your bluetooth device is visible)
by default it is `aa-proxy-CPUSERIAL`
for dongle mode you need to set it to: `AndroidAuto-xxxxx`

connect.description:
Auto-connect to phone and initiate connection
empty string/no value: don't auto-connect,
zeros: iterate over all previously connected devices,
may be set to a comma seperated list of phone BT MAC addresses for connecting to a specific list of phones, wildcard may not be used with list

bt_timeout_secs.description: Bluetooth handshake timeout [seconds], this is for rare cases when the phone stops responding, to prevent the bluetooth handshake deadlock with inifite waiting and not restarting connection again

iface.description: WLAN / Wi-Fi Hotspot interface (for obtaining IP and BSSID)

hostapd_conf.description: hostapd.conf file location (used for obtaining AP SSID and WPA passphrase)

change_usb_order.description: Connect to HU USB before Bluetooth handshake

remove_bluetooth.description: Remove Bluetooth service from `service discovery response`

remove_wifi.description: Remove Wi-Fi service from `service discovery response`

stop_on_disconnect.description: Stop working on manual `Disconnect` from phone

waze_lht_workaround.description: Enable `Waze` workaround for LHT (Left-Hand Traffic) countries by swaping U_TURN_LEFT to U_TURN_RIGHT in navigation / HUD

ev_battery_logger.description:
Path to script executed when Android Auto session starts/stops and EV battery data is needed
Argument "start" or "stop" is appended automatically when invoked

ev_connector_types.description:
List of EV connector types supported by your car. Possible values (separate multiple with a comma ','):
EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_J1772, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_MENNEKES, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_CHADEMO, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_COMBO_1, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_COMBO_2, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_TESLA_SUPERCHARGER, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_GBT

If left empty, the default is EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_MENNEKES.

eth_mode.description:
Configure Ethernet mode (optional). Options:
- `DHCP` (case-insensitive): dynamic IP assignment
- Static IP: e.g. `192.168.100.1/24`
- Leave blank to disable
